TopicTitle: I can't right click after adding mods

Articles.Content:

P8Z68-PRO

16G DDR3

GeForce GTX 580

WIN7 64x Pro

Problem: Can't right click after adding mods

Mods installed:

CactEye 2

Chatterer

?

Log:

<link>Output_log.txt

Edited February 3, 2015 by kaoz

Reinstall base KSP. Looks like some behavioural scripts for the assemblies are missing or invalid. After that, reinstall your mods. Also, be sure to run KSP 32-bit version, as the KSP 64-bit is extremely unstable. If you do manage to get the KSP 64-bit running, and this issue occurs with the 64-bit, than do not fear, this is a known bug with the 64-bit version. Well, that depends what you mean by "Can't right click after adding mods". Does this happen after you close KSP? Is it during KSP? Perhaps both? We're going to need a little bit more information to diagnose this. Also, remove all mods that are not up to date with the current version of KSP. I see a lot of "file missing" and "filename not valid" and other things like that in the log, which means that one of your mods is not up to date with the current version of KSP, is not installed correctly or is corrupt. The first mod I would uninstall would be city lights, as there are a lot of "filenotfound" errors relating to CITUtil.

Cheers,

Thank you for the quick help I'm sorry if I wasn't too detail, this happens only during fly launch pad and space not in the hangar during build and it stared after I installed all the mods wich I idid all at once, and I'm running ksp 32bit I made a mistake, I wrote my OS version not the games, thank you again for the help I'll try your suggesions I

Edited February 3, 2015 by kaoz

Hey.

I have/had the same problem. In my case this was caused by the "Mission Controller 2" mod.

The mods, i have installed:

USI Tools - 0.3.2

And one mod is not compatible with the Mission Controller 2.

I hope this will help you =)

Well, seeing as its 32bit, it is a problem with one of the mods. If the steps in my previous post do not work then i would suggest removing all your mods then adding them back in one by one to see which one is the culprit.

Cheers,
Thank you all for the help, I reinstall ksp and in the process of installing mod by mod, I'll post my findings of the conflict when I'm done
I'll be tracking this thread, as my context menu for my in-flight game doesn't work at all for parts, so I'm hoping what you find will help me.
